q: A gentleman is one who puts more into the world than he takes out.
h:
“A gentleman is one who puts more into the world than he takes out.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.
h:
“Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
h:
“Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.
h:
“Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: I try more and more to be myself, caring relatively little whether people approve or disapprove.
h:
“I try more and more to be myself, caring relatively little whether people approve or disapprove.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.
h:
“I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.” —
Mother Teresa

q: It is your attitude, not your aptitude, that determines your altitude.
h:
“It is your attitude, not your aptitude, that determines your altitude.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
h:
“You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.” —
William Faulkner

q: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself
h:
“When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Definitions belong to the definers, not the defined.
h:
“Definitions belong to the definers, not the defined.” —
Toni Morrison

q: You don't know who is important to you until you actually lose them.
h:
“You don't know who is important to you until you actually lose them.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
h:
“Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.” —
Helen Keller

q: What are we doing here, that is the question.
h:
“What are we doing here, that is the question.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
h:
“Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: Think and wonder, wonder and think.
h:
“Think and wonder, wonder and think.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Life is like stepping onto a boat which is about to sail out to sea and sink.
h:
“Life is like stepping onto a boat which is about to sail out to sea and sink.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
h:
“It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.” —
Seneca

q: Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.
h:
“Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers.
h:
“All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: Longevity is a fleeting moment that lasts forever.
h:
“Longevity is a fleeting moment that lasts forever.” —
Vidal Sassoon

q: No one ever said life was fair. Just Eventful.
h:
“No one ever said life was fair. Just Eventful.” —
Carol Burnett

q: She who loves roses must be patient and not cry out when she is pierced by thorns.
h:
“She who loves roses must be patient and not cry out when she is pierced by thorns.” —
Kenji Miyazawa

q: Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.
h:
“Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.
h:
“A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.” —
Barack Obama

q: Living life in style also means living a life of balance.
h:
“Living life in style also means living a life of balance.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Cease striving. Then there will be transformation.
h:
“Cease striving. Then there will be transformation.” —
Zhuangzi

q: The more something scares you, the more you should do it.
h:
“The more something scares you, the more you should do it.” —
Mark Manson

q: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
h:
“Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Don't worry about being successful, but work toward being significant and the success will naturally follow.
h:
“Don't worry about being successful, but work toward being significant and the success will naturally follow.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
h:
“It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one. ” —
George Washington

q: If there is a book that you want to read, but it hasn't been written yet, then you must write it.
h:
“If there is a book that you want to read, but it hasn't been written yet, then you must write it.” —
Toni Morrison

q: Through discipline comes freedom.
h:
“Through discipline comes freedom.” —
Aristotle

q: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
h:
“A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.” —
Criss Jami

q: Don't stop when you're tired. Stop when you're done.
h:
“Don't stop when you're tired. Stop when you're done.” —
Marilyn Monroe

q: Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.
h:
“Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.” —
James Allen

q: The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.
h:
“The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures.
h:
“People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures.” —
Gary Keller

q: Invisible things are the only realities.
h:
“Invisible things are the only realities.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: If you cling to a certain thought with dynamic will power, it finally assumes a tangible outward form.
h:
“If you cling to a certain thought with dynamic will power, it finally assumes a tangible outward form.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: An inventor is a man who asks Why? of the universe and lets nothing stand between the answer and his mind.
h:
“An inventor is a man who asks Why? of the universe and lets nothing stand between the answer and his mind.” —
Ayn Rand

q: The only defense against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
h:
“The only defense against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.” —
John Locke

q: Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.
h:
“Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.
h:
“Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.” —
Helen Keller

q: Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-correction.
h:
“Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-correction.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Do not look for a sanctuary in anyone except your self.
h:
“Do not look for a sanctuary in anyone except your self.” —
Buddha

q: Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success.
h:
“Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success. ” —
Henry Ford

q: To know your Enemy, you must become your Enemy.
h:
“To know your Enemy, you must become your Enemy.” —
Sun Tzu

q: The unthankful heart discovers no mercies; but the thankful heart will find, in every hour, some heavenly blessings.
h:
“The unthankful heart discovers no mercies; but the thankful heart will find, in every hour, some heavenly blessings.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.
h:
“Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.
h:
“Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.” —
Amelia Earhart
